info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 1:44PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... Plateau Creek near Cameo affecting Mesa County. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of heavy rain falling on a deep snowpack upstream will lead to an increase in runoff from snowmelt. Flows in rivers will continue to increase through the end of the week. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Plateau Creek near Cameo. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Some lowland flooding can be expected along Route 65 just east of the I-70 intersection. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 7.8 feet Friday morning. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
